column4: Greece's NBG hires Goldman  Morgan Stanley on sale of insurance unit: sources
column5: ATHENS Greece's second largest lender National Bank (NBG) has hired Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley as advisors on the sale of a stake in its insurance subsidiary National Insurance  banking sources close to the procedure said on Thursday.

column4: Aradigm's inhaled antibiotic fails late-stage study  shares sink
column5: Aradigm Corp said on Thursday its inhaled antibiotic for a rare  incurable disorder affecting the lungs failed in a late-stage study  sending the company's shares down nearly 54 percent in premarket trading.

column2: Barclays Inverse US Treasury Composite ETN
column4: Exclusive: Barclays to close down energy business within Macro trading division - memo
column5: LONDON Barclays will close the energy business within its 'Macro' trading division  the bank said in an internal memo on Thursday obtained by Reuters  in a move that will affect dozens of jobs at the British lender.

column4: Comcast's Fandango Media to buy Peru's online movie ticketer Cinepapaya
column5: Fandango Media LLC  an online movie ticketing platform owned by Comcast Corp   said on Thursday it would buy Peru-based Cinepapaya to expand in Latin America.

column4: Facebook developing artificial intelligence to flag offensive live videos
column5: MENLO PARK  Calif. Facebook Inc  is working on automatically flagging offensive material in live video streams  building on a growing effort to use artificial intelligence to monitor content  said Joaquin Candela  the company’s director of applied machine learning.

column4: Facebook COO Sandberg donates $100 million to donor advised fund
column5: Facebook Inc Chief Operating Officer Sheryl Sandberg has donated more than $100 million to the Sheryl Sandberg & Dave Goldberg Family Fund.

column4: SpaceX aims for December 16 return to flight  customer Iridium says
column5: CAPE CANAVERAL  Fla. Tech billionaire Elon Musk’s SpaceX hopes to return its Falcon 9 rocket to flight on Dec. 16  said Iridium Communications Inc  which plans to have 10 of its satellites on board for launching.

column4: SpaceX aims for December 16 return to flight  customer Iridium says
column5: CAPE CANAVERAL  Fla. Tech billionaire Elon Musk’s SpaceX hopes to return its Falcon 9 rocket to flight on Dec. 16  said Iridium Communications Inc  which plans to have 10 of its satellites on board for launching.

column4: Lower food prices weigh on Kroger's profit forecast
column5: Kroger Co   the biggest U.S. supermarket chain  tempered its forecasts for the remainder of the year amid pressure from falling food prices and intense competition from grocery sellers  ranging from Wal-Mart  to Amazon .

column4: ADM sells stake in Australia's GrainCorp
column5: CHICAGO U.S. agricultural commodities trader Archer Daniels Midland Co  has sold its 19.9 percent stake in GrainCorp Ltd  to underwriters UBS just three years after a failed bid to wholly acquire the Australian grain handler  ADM said on Thursday.

column4: AstraZeneca in broad drug deal with Bicycle worth up to $1 billion
column5: LONDON AstraZeneca has signed a wide-ranging deal with private biotech firm Bicycle Therapeutics to develop a novel class of small molecule medicines for treating respiratory  cardiovascular and metabolic diseases.

column4: AstraZeneca in broad drug deal with Bicycle worth up to $1 billion
column5: LONDON AstraZeneca has signed a wide-ranging deal with private biotech firm Bicycle Therapeutics to develop a novel class of small molecule medicines for treating respiratory  cardiovascular and metabolic diseases.

column4: Exclusive: Barclays to close down energy business within Macro trading division - memo
column5: LONDON Barclays will close the energy business within its 'Macro' trading division  the bank said in an internal memo on Thursday obtained by Reuters  in a move that will affect dozens of jobs at the British lender.

column4: BP approves $9 billion Mad Dog project in Gulf  a first since spill
column5: LONDON Oil major BP has approved a $9-billion investment in its Mad Dog project in the Gulf of Mexico  its first major new platform in the region since a 2010 explosion at its Macondo well led to the worst offshore disaster in U.S. history.

column4: Shell ties in bonuses to reinforced emissions strategy
column5: LONDON Royal Dutch Shell plans to link part of its executive bonuses to greenhouse gas emissions and conduct more active screening of future investments to further efforts to reduce the energy group's carbon footprint  its CEO told Reuters.

column4: Carnival Princess to pay record $40 million for pollution cover-up
column5: WASHINGTON Carnival Corp's Princess Cruise Lines will plead guilty to seven felony charges for polluting the seas and deliberate acts to cover it up  and pay a record $40 million criminal penalty  the U.S. Justice Department said on Thursday.

column4: Comcast's Fandango Media to buy Peru's online movie ticketer Cinepapaya
column5: Fandango Media LLC  an online movie ticketing platform owned by Comcast Corp   said on Thursday it would buy Peru-based Cinepapaya to expand in Latin America.

column4: Exclusive: Cummins to explore sale of its filtration business - sources
column5: Cummins Inc   a U.S. manufacturer of engines for large trucks  is preparing to explore the sale of a business that makes filters and coolants  potentially valuing it at more than $1.5 billion  according to people familiar with the matter.

column4: Delta pilots get 30 percent raise by 2019 in new contract
column5: MONTREAL/NEW YORK Delta Air Lines Inc  pilots on Thursday agreed to a new contract that delivers a 30 percent pay raise by 2019  as the aviation industry deals with mounting demand for higher wages to fly planes at a time of big profits.

column4: Lower grocery prices  food stamp cuts hit Dollar General results
column5: Discount retailer Dollar General Corp  reported a surprise drop in quarterly comparable sales and tempered its full-year profit forecast  hit by lower grocery prices and reduced food stamp coverage in several U.S. states. | Video

column4: CA buys Austrian peer Automic in $635 million deal
column5: FRANKFURT U.S. software management group CA Inc  said on Thursday it has agreed to buy Austrian business automation firm Automic from private equity group EQT in a 600 million euro ($635 million) deal as it seeks to expand in Europe.

column4: ExxonMobil leaves McLaren for Red Bull F1 team
column5: LONDON McLaren have lost another long-term partner to Formula One rivals Red Bull with oil giant ExxonMobil following the example of Tag Heuer.

column4: Questions resurface about who would succeed longtime Goldman CEO
column5: Goldman Sachs Group Inc  is again facing questions about who would succeed longtime Chief Executive Officer Lloyd Blankfein when he eventually steps down.

column4: Brazil targets Itaú in new tax probe phase  source says
column5: SAO PAULO Brazil's federal police on Thursday launched a raid targeting Itaú Unibanco Holding SA as part of a probe into alleged bribery of tax officials  a source briefed on the matter said.

column4: Lower food prices weigh on Kroger's profit forecast
column5: Kroger Co   the biggest U.S. supermarket chain  tempered its forecasts for the remainder of the year amid pressure from falling food prices and intense competition from grocery sellers  ranging from Wal-Mart  to Amazon .

column4: Mastercard and Verifone launch UK point-of-sale financing app
column5: CANNES  France British shoppers will soon be able to decide to spread the cost of a purchase over a series of monthly installments at the point of making a payment with their credit card  in a new partnership between Mastercard Inc card machine maker Verifone Systems Inc.

column4: McDonald's drops supplier in Malaysia over worker exploitation claims
column5: KUALA LUMPUR (Thomson Reuters Foundation) - Fast food giant McDonald's said it has dropped a labor supply agency in Malaysia after claims emerged that it was underpaying its migrant workers and housing them in appalling conditions.

column4: Big Mac creator dies at 98
column5: The man behind one of the most recognizable fast-food sandwiches  McDonald's Big Mac  died this week at age 98.

column4: Energy Future bankruptcy exit hearings set for February
column5: WILMINGTON  Del. Texas power company Energy Future Holdings Corp will start hearings in February to confirm its Chapter 11 bankruptcy exit plan and its proposed sale of its power lines business to NextEra Energy Inc  for $18.6 billion  a judge said on Thursday.

column4: Fallen smartphone brand Nokia challenges Apple  Samsung again
column5: FRANKFURT/HELSINKI Nokia smartphones are poised for a comeback after former managers at the Finnish company licensed the handset brand from Microsoft and struck up partnerships with Google and phone manufacturer Foxconn.

column4: Parker-Hannifin to buy Clarcor to double filtration systems business
column5: Parker-Hannifin Corp   whose motion and control systems are used in a variety of industries  said on Thursday it would buy Clarcor Inc  for about $4.3 billion  including debt  to double the size of its filtration systems business.

column4: Linde chairman backs deal with Praxair: Handelsblatt
column5: FRANKFURT Linde  supervisory board Chairman Wolfgang Reitzle is still in favor of a tie-up between the German industrial gases maker and U.S. rival Praxair   which has made a renewed merger proposal  German newspaper Handelsblatt reported.

column4: Raymond James says Thomas James to become chairman emeritus
column5: Brokerage Raymond James Financial Inc  said on Thursday that Thomas James would relinquish his role as chairman of its board and become chairman emeritus.

column4: Fisher & Paykel wins German court case against ResMed
column5: WELLINGTON Fisher & Paykel Healthcare Corporation Ltd said on Friday a German court has overturned both preliminary injunctions granted to ResMed Inc  which had taken  legal action against the New Zealand-based medical device maker.

column4: Rio Tinto says target of SEC probe over Mozambique coal
column5: SYDNEY Global miner Rio Tinto said on Thursday it was cooperating with the U.S. Securities Exchange Commission over financial impairments in 2012 related to its coal operations in Mozambique.

column4: Wall Street steps into Skechers after CEO buys shares
column5: SAN FRANCISCO Skechers USA's stock  was on track for its best day in over two years on Thursday after the shoe seller's chief executive bought $11 million worth of the beleaguered shares and a brokerage recommended it after viewing new products at a trade show.

column4: U.S. bill would allow Wells customers go to court over scandal
column5: Legislation introduced by two Democratic lawmakers on Thursday would allow Wells Fargo & Co customers to go to court  instead of private arbitration  to resolve claims about accounts opened without authorization  according to a media release.

column4: Wells Fargo amends bylaws to separate chairman and CEO roles
column5: Wells Fargo & Co  said on Thursday its board had amended bylaws to require that the bank separate the chairman and chief executive roles  a win for activists who had pressed for the change after a scandal over unauthorized customer accounts.

column4: Wells Fargo to keep brokerage retirement plans under fiduciary rule
column5: NEW YORK Wells Fargo & Co  said it will continue to offer individual retirement accounts that pay brokers commissions and will adjust procedures to comply with a new U.S. financial regulation that requires companies to put clients' interests first  according to a memo sent to staff on Thursday.

column4: Greece's NBG hires Goldman  Morgan Stanley on sale of insurance unit: sources
column5: ATHENS Greece's second largest lender National Bank (NBG) has hired Goldman Sachs and Morgan Stanley as advisors on the sale of a stake in its insurance subsidiary National Insurance  banking sources close to the procedure said on Thursday.
